title: Flatten EDGAR structure deterministically
description: Ensure flatten output is stable and Arelle-compatible.

comments.author: IvoryFinch
comments.text: Added schemaRef URL parsing helper so basename extraction ignores query/fragment (uses urlparse). Keeps deterministic selection stable across absolute/relative schemaRef hrefs.

comments.author: zac
comments.text:
Scope: Ensure flatten command produces deterministic, Arelle-compatible layouts.
Why: Pack must be reproducible from flat artifacts.
Acceptance: Same input yields identical flat output and file ordering.
Notes: Avoid nondeterministic file names or timestamps.

comments.author: zac
comments.text:
Files: `src/cmdrvl_xew/flatten.py` (deterministic flattening).
Parallel-safe: avoid touching cli.py here.

comments.author: DarkOtter
comments.text: Starting work on deterministic flattening; will make directory scans and selection order stable.

comments.author: DarkOtter
comments.text: Updated flatten.py to iterate directories deterministically (sorted entries, explicit form/exhibit order) and copy with copy2 for stable timestamps. Ready for review.

title: flatten CLI options + constraints
description: Validate input directories and deterministic output pathing.

comments.author: zac
comments.text:
Scope: Validate flatten CLI inputs and deterministic output pathing.
Why: Flatten is the entry point for pack inputs.
Acceptance: Errors are explicit; output layout is stable.
Notes: Avoid implicit behavior that changes output order.

comments.author: zac
comments.text:
Files: `src/cmdrvl_xew/cli.py` (flatten args) and `src/cmdrvl_xew/flatten.py` (behavior).
Parallel-safe: if in parallel, split CLI args vs flatten logic.

comments.author: DarkOtter
comments.text: Starting bd-111. Will add guard to prevent --out from being inside the source EDGAR directory (or equal).

comments.author: DarkOtter
comments.text: Added guard in flatten.py to prevent output directory being inside (or equal to) source EDGAR directory.

title: Pin rule basis map (xew_rule_basis_map.v1.json)
description: Add citations with retrieved_at + sha256 per shipped issue_code; enforce Gate inputs.

comments.author: zac
comments.text:
Scope: Populate src/cmdrvl_xew/spec/xew_rule_basis_map.v1.json with citations per issue_code.
Why: Gate requires a pinned rule basis (retrieved_at + sha256) to ship any alert.
Acceptance: Every shipping issue_code has at least one pinned citation; missing basis suppresses alerts.
Notes: Citations must be reproducible and stored in the pack metadata.

comments.author: zac
comments.text:
Files: `src/cmdrvl_xew/spec/xew_rule_basis_map.v1.json`.
Parallel-safe: spec-only changes.

comments.text: Extended edgar_fetch with accession_base_url + fetch_accession_items (tries index.json then index.html) and filters index.html entries; added _fetch_text helper.

comments.author: zac
comments.text:

Parallelization: this unlocks one-file-per-pattern detector implementations.

title: XEW-M005 duplicate cleanup marker
description: Detect sharp drop in duplicate signatures across filings.

comments.author: zac
comments.text:
Scope: Detect duplicate cleanup events (XEW-M005).
Why: Sharp duplicate drops indicate refactors that affect triage.
Acceptance: Evidence includes duplicate signature counts and examples.
Notes: Marker is not an alert by itself.

title: Value normalization for duplicate conflict checks
description: Normalize numeric/string values for conflict detection in P001.

comments.author: zac
comments.text:
Scope: Normalize fact values for P001 conflict detection.
Why: Duplicates require consistent comparison to flag conflicts.
Acceptance: Numeric/string normalization is deterministic and documented.
Notes: Keep raw values in evidence; normalization is for comparison only.

comments.author: zac
comments.text:
Files: `src/cmdrvl_xew/util.py` (value normalization helpers).
Parallel-safe: avoid touching detector modules.

title: Deterministic canonicalization + IDs
description: Deterministic signatures, ordering, and hashing for reproducible findings.
close_reason: All sub-tasks completed: bd-4ay (QName normalization), bd-3iy (deterministic IDs), bd-am3 (unit equivalence), bd-3lf (canonical signature), bd-27o (ordering), bd-13w (value normalization), bd-3aw (typed dimensions). Deterministic canonicalization framework is complete.

comments.author: zac
comments.text:
Background: Deterministic IDs and hashing are core to reproducibility.
Goal: Implement canonicalization rules for signatures, ordering, and hashing.
Non-goals: Any heuristic similarity scoring.
Acceptance: Same inputs always yield byte-identical outputs and instance_ids.

title: Marker thresholds + pack recording
description: Define numeric thresholds and record in Evidence Pack.

comments.author: zac
comments.text:
Scope: Define numeric thresholds for all markers and record them in the pack.
Why: Qualitative terms must become deterministic rules.
Acceptance: Thresholds are explicit, versioned, and included in toolchain/config output.
Notes: Changes require versioning to avoid silent drift.

title: Deterministic cache + retrieval metadata
description: Cache artifacts and record retrieval metadata for repro.
close_reason: Completed deterministic cache + retrieval metadata. Created cache.py module with DeterministicCache, integrated with EDGAR fetcher via cached variants, comprehensive metadata recording for pack reproducibility.

comments.author: zac
comments.text:
Phase - Future Work: Add deterministic cache and retrieval metadata.
Why: Repro requires stable artifact bytes and timestamps.
Acceptance: Cache keys are deterministic and recorded in pack metadata.
Notes: Cache should be optional and transparent.

title: Build pack_manifest.json with hashes
description: Pack manifest writer module (pack_manifest.json) with sha256 hashing and roles.

comments.author: zac
comments.text:
Scope: Build pack_manifest.json with sha256 for each artifact and metadata.
Why: Manifest provides tamper-evident integrity for the pack.
Acceptance: Manifest is deterministic, ordered, and includes all artifacts and metadata.
Notes: Hashing must be stable across platforms.

comments.author: zac
comments.text:
Files: `src/cmdrvl_xew/pack_manifest.py` (new module).
Parallel-safe: do not edit pack.py; expose a small function to compute manifest.

title: Repro runbook

comments.author: zac
comments.text:
Scope: Author a reproducibility runbook for internal and external use.
Why: Pack should be reproducible without tribal knowledge.
Acceptance: Runbook lists exact steps, tooling versions, and inputs.
Notes: Separate evidence from interpretation.

comments.author: zac
comments.text:
Files: `docs/` (runbook doc; pick a dedicated file to avoid conflicts).

comments.text: Starting bd-1gn. Will collect comparator artifacts, copy into pack, and include in artifacts[] + pack_manifest.

title: Pack orchestrator wiring (pack.py)

close_reason: Pack orchestrator wiring complete! Successfully integrated all infrastructure components: detector registry, findings writer, pack manifest builder, toolchain recorder, and directory layout. Full Evidence Pack pipeline operational with end-to-end testing successful.

comments.author: zac
comments.text:
Files: `src/cmdrvl_xew/pack.py` (orchestrator only).
Parallel-safe: integrate modules and registry; avoid detector logic here.

title: V1 pattern detectors and gating
description: Implement v1 shipping pattern detection with Gate enforcement and priority.
close_reason: All major components complete: detector scaffolding (bd-13b), all v1 detectors (P001, P002, P004, P005), and Gate enforcement (bd-363) are closed. Dependencies bd-geg, bd-15x, bd-25c also closed.

comments.author: zac
comments.text:
Background: v1 alerts are limited to four patterns and must pass the Gate.
Goal: Implement detectors + Gate enforcement + priority selection for v1 shipping patterns.
Non-goals: Semantic or speculative checks (e.g., unrelatedness).
Acceptance: Each detector emits reproducible evidence with pinned rule basis or is suppressed.

title: Hash stability regression test
description: Re-run pack to confirm identical hashes.

comments.author: zac
comments.text:
Scope: Regression test for hash stability across repeated runs.
Why: Detects nondeterministic ordering or serialization.
Acceptance: Multiple runs yield identical manifest and findings hashes.
Notes: Ensure test runs in CI without network access.

title: Historical adaptation markers (v1)
description: Compute change-point markers to provide context in findings and packs.

comments.author: zac
comments.text:
Background: Adaptation markers provide triage context, not alerts.
Goal: Compute v1 markers from a rolling filing history window with explicit thresholds.
Non-goals: Claims about causality or enforcement motivations.
Acceptance: Markers are reproducible and recorded with supporting evidence.

comments.author: IvoryFinch
comments.text: Added marker output payload note in plan (marker_id/boundary/evidence + thresholds recorded for reproducibility).

comments.author: IvoryFinch
comments.text: Added suggested evidence field names for marker output (metric/from_value/to_value/delta/threshold/sample_accessions).

Acceptance: Fields are optional and versioned; no behavior change in v1.

Non-goals: Auto-alerting or semantic judgments in v1.

title: History validation can crash when accession missing
description: validate_pack_args uses accession_pattern inside history validation; if args.accession is missing/None, accession_pattern is undefined and history validation can crash instead of returning errors. Move regex compile outside try or guard history validation when accession missing.

title: Fix Python 3.9 compatibility: Replace union operator syntax
description: Detector files use Python 3.10+ union syntax (type | None) causing import failures on Python 3.9.7. Replace with Optional[type] for compatibility.
close_reason: Fixed Python 3.9 compatibility issue in p005_taxonomy.py by replacing 'DetectorInstance | None' with 'Optional[DetectorInstance]'. Detector infrastructure now imports successfully and tests pass.

title: Pattern priority selection logic
description: When multiple patterns hit, select highest priority by catalog order.

comments.author: zac
comments.text:
Scope: Implement pattern priority selection (P001 > P004 > P005 > P002).
Why: v1 sends at most one external alert per filing by default.
Acceptance: Highest-priority detected pattern is selected deterministically.
Notes: Still record other detections internally when applicable.

comments.author: zac
comments.text:
Files: `src/cmdrvl_xew/detectors/registry.py` (priority ordering logic).
Parallel-safe: no edits to pack.py needed beyond registry wiring in bd-1kw.

comments.author: zac
comments.text: Added deterministic tie-breaker (priority, pattern_id, finding_id) in registry select_highest_priority_finding.

title: Gate enforcement for shipped patterns
description: Require rule basis per issue_code; demote if missing.
close_reason: Gate enforcement implemented in DetectorRegistry. Findings without valid rule basis (source/retrieved_at/sha256/url) are demoted to non-alert status with 'suppressed_by_gate' status. Tested and verified working correctly for v1 compliance.

comments.author: zac
comments.text:
Scope: Enforce the Gate: no alert ships without a pinned rule basis.
Why: Prevents unsupported claims and silent drift.
Acceptance: Missing rule basis demotes the pattern to non-alert output.
Notes: Gate must be enforced before alert selection.

comments.author: zac
comments.text:
Files: `src/cmdrvl_xew/detectors/registry.py` (Gate enforcement lives in registry).
Parallel-safe: no edits to pattern modules required.

comments.author: SilverHeron
comments.text: Gate enforcement now uses schema-valid suppression: status='suppressed' and suppression_reason set when rule basis missing/invalid or on error.

title: flatten: schemaRef basename should strip query/fragment for relative hrefs
description: _schema_basename in src/cmdrvl_xew/flatten.py only strips query/fragment when schemaRef has scheme/netloc. Relative hrefs like 'foo.xsd?rev=1' or 'foo.xsd#bar' will keep the suffix and break extension file matching. Fix by always using urlparse(...).path (fallback to schema_ref if empty).

comments.author: IvoryFinch
comments.text: Fixed schemaRef basename parsing to always use urlparse(path) (fallback to schema_ref if empty) so relative hrefs with query/fragment resolve correctly.

title: Record non-redistributable artifact references
description: pack.py collects non_redistributable_refs for skipped artifacts but never records them in toolchain/manifest; Evidence Pack loses trace of omitted artifacts, undermining reproducibility.

description: README documents a cmdrvl-xew fetch command and flags, but cli.py does not implement a fetch subcommand. Decide to implement fetch or remove/mark docs as future/experimental to avoid misleading users.

comments.author: IvoryFinch
comments.text: Updated README fetch section to mark it as planned/not yet implemented and labeled flags as planned to avoid CLI mismatch.

title: verify-pack: hash verification
description: Recompute hashes and fail on mismatch.
close_reason: Hash verification functionality is implemented in verify.py per IvoryFinch review. Blocking dependency bd-1dx (manifest writer) is now closed.

comments.author: zac
comments.text:
Scope: verify-pack recomputes hashes and fails on mismatch.
Why: Detects tampering or accidental changes.
Acceptance: Any hash mismatch yields non-zero exit and clear error.
Notes: Use the manifest as source of truth.

comments.author: zac
comments.text:
Files: `src/cmdrvl_xew/verify.py` (hash verification).
Parallel-safe: isolate changes to verify.py.

comments.author: IvoryFinch
comments.text: Reviewed src/cmdrvl_xew/verify.py: recomputes sha256/bytes for each manifest entry, reports mismatches, and returns non-zero on any failure. Accepts manifest as source of truth.

comments.author: IvoryFinch
comments.text: Tried closing but blocked by bd-1dx. verify.py already implements hash verification; can close once manifest writer bead is closed.

title: Phase 1 - cmdrvl-xew v1 Evidence Pack engine
description: Top-level delivery for v1 CLI engine and Evidence Pack generation (scope: cmdrvl-xew repo).

comments.author: zac
comments.text:
Background: The plan defines cmdrvl-xew as the deterministic Evidence Pack engine (not monitoring or delivery).
Goal: Deliver the v1 CLI that emits xew_findings.json + Evidence Pack for the v1 shipping patterns.
Non-goals: Orchestration, alert delivery, dashboards, or any semantic/interpretive claims.
Acceptance: Pack + verify-pack operate deterministically on flat artifacts and match the contract/schema.
Notes: Reproducibility is the product; no output drift without versioning and pinned rule basis.
